title: Weekend roundup: Readers debate the value of a $350,000 salary
text:
Here are must-read MarketWatch articles about investing and personal finance from the past week.

1. Join the debate about how far a $350,000 salary can be stretched

MarketWatch readers left over 500 comments.

2. New systems may save you a lot of money on real-estate commissions

As the Best New Ideas in Money series continues, over 150 readers chime in on how artificial intelligence may greatly lower the cost of selling a home.

More coverage of the real-estate market:

• This city’s real-estate market is the least likely to tank during the next recession

• How I bought a home in one of the most expensive real-estate markets in the U.S.

3. Apple’s new strategy

Apple AAPL, -1.94% had its annual rollout of new products and services this week, emphasizing a new business strategy — competing on price.

More on Apple:

• Apple’s streaming service is cheap, but how does it stack up against Amazon, Netflix and Disney?

• Barron’s: Apple is smarter than everyone thought

• In the battle of the $1 trillion companies, Microsoft MSFT, -0.20% is still bigger and better.

4. Cloud stocks

Here’s how to pick long-term winners in the cloud computing space.

5. Trump and ‘zero or even negative’ interest rates

Here are reactions to President Trump’s suggestion that the Federal Reserve should follow the policies of other central banks and bring U.S. interest rates as low as possible.

Related: Trump wants even lower interest rates: What that would mean for your retirement savings

6. Making your retirement money last

You may have read that withdrawing 4% from your retirement investment account is a reasonable way to sustain your nest egg. But a new study shows that making relatively small adjustments to your withdrawals can keep you from running out of money.

7. Keep it simple

Here’s an easy way for you to waste less money.

8. Investors need to learn from millennials

Here’s how investors can take advantage of the preferences of the largest component of the U.S. labor force.

9. Expanding small businesses into international companies

New machine translation technology is making it much easier to reach customers around the world.

10. CEO interview: Canopy Growth

Canopy Growth CGC, +3.05% is an important player in the marijuana industry, controlled by Constellation Brands, the STZ, +0.37%, the brewer of Corona beer. Canopy CEO Mark Zekulin discussed the company’s future and trends in cannabis distribution, following the ouster of his former co-CEO, Bruce Linton.

Want more from MarketWatch? Check out our Personal Finance Daily or other newsletters, and get the latest news, personal finance and investing advice.
description: Also, cloud stocks and President Trump’s interest-rate policy ideas.
